Articles.Content:
Having a regular look through whats happening with launches/landings and anything space related when I come across the story about the next GPS launch

http://spaceflightnow.com/delta/d366/preview.html#.U3JWKijJ_mg

I maybe a bit crazy, but does'nt that delta picture look like a 1001 KSP launches with a mainsail/skipper engine, a jumbo 64 fuel tank and some SRBs... heck even the assembly drawing looks like its been cadged from KSP

Boris

Or have I spent too many hours playing KSP ? .....

You've definitely been playing too much KSP, regardless of the subject of this thread, as all of us have. Delta IV is a pretty neat rocket. When the NASA pack came out I was wondering if the Kerbodyne KR-2L was based roughly on the RS-68, which is the engine that powers the Common Booster Core from the Delta family. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RS-68

And the new parts in 0.23.5 are suspiciously similar to NASA's new SLS.

I would guess the Jumbo 64 was inspired by the shuttle's ET and the Delta IV.

You've definitely been playing too much KSP, regardless of the subject of this thread, as all of us have. Delta IV is a pretty neat rocket. When the NASA pack came out I was wondering if the Kerbodyne KR-2L was based roughly on the RS-68, which is the engine that powers the Common Booster Core from the Delta family. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RS-68

KR-2L is based (very roughly) on the J-2X.

KR-2L is based (very roughly) on the J-2X.

Oh, that makes more sense I guess.
You know you play too much KSP when you think actual rocket parts look like KSP instead of KSP looking like actual rocket parts. Lol.
OP has a point though. The whole exploded view with the tanks, engines, boosters, fairings, etc. all shown as separate parts really evokes KSP.
Yeah. The other day I found myself reading something about space in Scott Manley's voice. I get it too lol

You know you play too much KSP when you think actual rocket parts look like KSP instead of KSP looking like actual rocket parts. Lol.

This.

There are a lot of ksp parts that are modeled after the real thing.
